messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bumper stickers
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/8/03 7:04:29 PM Pacific Daylight Time, mina@mabb.net ... Hey Ren & Kelly!!! LOL I will have a booth at this years Los Angeles Pagan
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/8/03 7:04:29 PM Pacific Daylight Time, mina@...
writes:

> >>Life is the school
> >>Love is the lesson
>
> >NO WAY!!! Is it blue? Cuz if it is we have matching bumper stickers.
> >I bought it at a Pagan shop a couple months ago. COOL!
> >Ren
>
>
> I can't remember. But I, too, bought it in a Pagan shop. I also bought one
> (white) that says "Happy Heathen" but haven't gotten the guts up to put it
> on the car.
>
> Of course, my first car read "Magic is Afoot."
>
> Kelly
>

Hey Ren & Kelly!!! LOL I will have a booth at this years Los Angeles Pagan
festival and about a month ago, I asked my cousin to make t-shirts for me with
both these sayings along with about 40 others. Too funny!

Rhonda


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bumper stickers
messages.msgSnippet: ... I can t remember.  But I, too, bought it in a Pagan shop.  I also bought one (white) that says Happy Heathen but haven t gotten the guts up to put it on
messages.messageBody:
>> Life is the school
>> Love is the lesson

>NO WAY!!! Is it blue? Cuz if it is we have matching bumper stickers.
>I bought it at a Pagan shop a couple months ago. COOL!
>Ren


I can't remember. But I, too, bought it in a Pagan shop. I also bought one
(white) that says "Happy Heathen" but haven't gotten the guts up to put it
on the car.

Of course, my first car read "Magic is Afoot."

Kelly

messages.subject: bumper stickers
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/8/2003 5:32:08 PM Central Daylight Time, ... NO WAY!!! Is it blue? Cuz if it is we have matching bumper stickers. I bought it at a Pagan

Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

>

NO WAY!!! Is it blue? Cuz if it is we have matching bumper stickers.
I bought it at a Pagan shop a couple months ago. COOL!

Ren

>
> Sandra
>

~Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: bumper stickers
messages.msgSnippet: ************* Free to think, learn, do and be. Learning through life, joyfully! unschooling.com ********* oo I like.. think that s my favorite. ... From:
messages.messageBody:
*************"Free to think, learn, do and be.
Learning through life, joyfully!
unschooling.com"*********

oo I like.. think that's my favorite.

-------Original Message-------

From: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, May 06, 2003 17:34:57
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: bumper stickers

I've got two unschooling bumperstickers on my car right now.

"Learn from others, but go to your own school."

"Free the Children. (With the word school next to it with a red
circle/slash through it.) www.unschooling.com"

AnneO gave me a nicer version.

"Free to think, learn, do and be.
Learning through life, joyfully!
unschooling.com"

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/6/2003 4:00:19 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Last year s sticker was: Unschoolers Live & Learn We ll have a few of these for the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/6/2003 4:00:19 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
jmcseals@... writes:


> hmmmm....trying to get this worded right....
>
> Unschooling: Why read about life when you can LIVE it?
>
> Yeah, I think I like that! Not so prone to induce road rage! ;p
>
> I may have to have some of those printed up!! :)
>
> Jennifer
>

Last year's sticker was:

"Unschoolers Live & Learn"

We'll have a few of these for the conference:

"If you don't want to read this,
Thank a teacher." (thanks to Sandra!)

But we're also discussing another, less...hmmm.... irritating? ....one for
the "main" bumper sticker.

~Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] bumper stickers
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/25/2002 2:45:07 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... We have a lovely one! Two-toned blue & white: UNschoolers Live & Learn
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/25/2002 2:45:07 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
> Just a thought...but what about putting notes on bulletin boards at grocery
> and other stores? You know, something to the effect "Looking for
> alternatives to public school? Try Homeschooling!" <g> And of course one
> could put bumper-stickers on their cars. Make t-shirts and sell, wear,
> and/or give them away :)
>

We have a lovely one! Two-toned blue & white:

UNschoolers Live & Learn
SchoolsOutSupport.org

and you can find it for $2 at our website: SchoolsOutSupport.org

<g> Kelly
